text: [Music]
hi I'm Boyd Makiki from Amazon Web
Services in this video I'm going to
discuss the key to making use of Amazon
ec2 spot instances effectively with
instance flexibility I'll explain why
instance flexibility is so important and
how to confirm and think about what
instances will likely work for you let's
get started
spot instances are unused ec2 capacity
which means the amount of it available
in any one specific instance type and
size varies over time so by using more
than one instance option you increase
the pool of capacity you have access to
achieving greater scale and reduce the
impact of any one capacity pool gets
interrupted because spot instances are
often 70 to 90 percent cheaper than
on-demand instances you'll often be able
to find more powerful instances and
still save a fortune for example if you
needed two V CPUs and four gigs of
memory you might choose the C for large
on spot that's a 71 percent discount
versus C for large on demand however
even the M for large is a 70 percent
discount on spot versus running the C
for large on demand despite the fact
that has two V CPUs and eight gigs of
memory so hopefully by now you
understand why instance flexibility is
so important and agree it is possible to
use more than one instance type while
saving a fortune however you might
wonder how to automate the management of
different instance types in a single
application please check out easy to
flee unify the instances that work for
you and let ec2 fleet do the rest in
this video we've discussed why instance
flexibility is so important why it is
powerful and how ec2 fleet makes it easy
to find cost-effective Spock capacity
you can find out more information at
aws.amazon.com forward slash ec2 forward
slash spot thanks for watching
